get_hotel_rates.description: Retrieve detailed rate information for hotels. Supports multi-room bookings and flexible location search (by hotel IDs, city/country, or IATA code). The tool accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for currency (USD), guest nationality (US), max rates per hotel (1), refundable rates only (false), and room mapping (true). Returns an array of hotel offers with comprehensive rate details including pricing and room specifications.

inputs.checkin: string – required – check-in date in YYYY-MM-DD format (ISO 8601)
inputs.checkout: string – required – check-out date in YYYY-MM-DD format (ISO 8601)
inputs.occupancies: array – required – array of objects specifying number of guests per room. Each object must have 'adults' (integer, required) and optionally 'children' (array of integers, ages)
inputs.hotel_ids: array of strings – optional – array of hotel IDs to search for availability and pricing. At least one location identifier must be provided: hotel_ids, (city_name and country_code), or iata_code
inputs.city_name: string – optional – name of the city to search for hotels in. Must be paired with country_code
inputs.country_code: string – optional – country code in ISO 2-letter format (e.g., 'US', 'FR', 'SG'). Must be paired with city_name
inputs.iata_code: string – optional – IATA code of the search location, typically an airport code. At least one location identifier must be provided
inputs.currency: string – optional – currency in which prices will be displayed. Default: USD
inputs.guest_nationality: string – optional – guest's nationality in ISO 2-letter country code format. Default: US
inputs.max_rates_per_hotel: integer – optional – number of room rates to return per hotel, sorted by price (cheapest first). Default: 1
inputs.refundable_rates_only: boolean – optional – if true, only refundable rates will be included. Default: false
inputs.room_mapping: boolean – optional – enable room mapping to retrieve mappedRoomId for each room. Default: true
inputs.k: integer – optional – number of hotels to return (limited to top k results). Must be between 1 and 200. Default: 10

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.hotels: array – list of hotel offers with rate details, pricing, and room specifications
outputs.search_params: object – parameters used in this search including top_k: k
outputs.message: string – optional helpful message when no hotels found
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

The tool accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for currency (USD), guest nationality (US), max rates per hotel (1), refundable rates only (false), and room mapping (true). Returns an array of hotel offers sorted by price in ascending order with comprehensive rate details including pricing and room specifications.

inputs.checkout: string – required – check-out date in YYYY-MM-DD format (ISO 8601)

inputs.k: integer – required – number of top cheapest hotels to return (e.g., 5 returns top 5 cheapest hotels). Must be between 1 and 200
inputs.hotel_ids: array of strings – optional – array of hotel IDs to search for availability and pricing. At least one location identifier must be provided: hotel_ids, (city_name and country_code), or iata_code
inputs.city_name: string – optional – name of the city to search for hotels in. Must be paired with country_code
inputs.country_code: string – optional – country code in ISO 2-letter format (e.g., 'US', 'FR', 'SG'). Must be paired with city_name
inputs.iata_code: string – optional – IATA code of the search location, typically an airport code. At least one location identifier must be provided
inputs.currency: string – optional – currency in which prices will be displayed. Default: USD
inputs.guest_nationality: string – optional – guest's nationality in ISO 2-letter country code format. Default: US
inputs.max_rates_per_hotel: integer – optional – number of room rates to return per hotel, sorted by price (cheapest first). Default: 1
inputs.refundable_rates_only: boolean – optional – if true, only refundable rates will be included. Default: false
inputs.room_mapping: boolean – optional – enable room mapping to retrieve mappedRoomId for each room. Default: true

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.hotels: array – list of top k hotel offers sorted by price (lowest first) with rate details, pricing, and room specifications
outputs.search_params: object – parameters used in this search including top_k: k and sort_by: 'price'
outputs.message: string – optional helpful message when no hotels found

get_hotel_details.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific hotel using its unique identifier. Returns comprehensive hotel data including name, address, rating, amenities, images, description, room types, facilities, policies, and sentiment analysis. The tool accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language.

inputs.hotel_id: string – required – unique ID of the hotel
inputs.language: string – optional – language code for results (e.g., 'en', 'fr'). Default: system default

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.hotel: object – detailed hotel information including id, name, description, images, facilities, rooms, policies, rating, location, etc.
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

get_list_of_hotels.description: Search and retrieve a list of hotels based on various criteria WITHOUT requiring specific dates. This is the PRIMARY tool for general hotel browsing, finding hotels in a city, or searching by name. Use this when users want to browse hotels or get hotel information without booking specific rooms. Returns hotel metadata including names, addresses, ratings, amenities, images, and more. NO dates required – perfect for general browsing.
use_cases: User wants to browse hotels in a city (e.g., 'Find hotels in Beirut', 'Show me hotels in Paris')
User wants to search hotels by name (e.g., 'Find Hilton hotels in London')
User wants hotels in a specific area (geo-based search)
User wants hotels with specific ratings or star ratings
General hotel exploration WITHOUT specific booking dates
important_notes: NO DATES REQUIRED – This tool is for browsing, not booking
Use get_hotel_rates when user wants to BOOK or check AVAILABILITY (dates required)
Use get_hotel_details when you have a specific hotel_id and want full details
This tool returns general hotel information, not room availability or pricing

inputs.country_code: string – optional – Country code in ISO-2 format (e.g., 'LB' for Lebanon, 'FR' for France, 'US' for USA)
inputs.city_name: string – optional – Name of the city (e.g., 'Beirut', 'Paris', 'New York')
inputs.hotel_name: string – optional – Name or partial name of hotel for loose matching, case-insensitive (e.g., 'hilton', 'marriott')
inputs.offset: integer – optional – Number of results to skip for pagination. Default: 0
inputs.limit: integer – optional – Maximum number of results to return. Default: 100, Maximum: 5000
inputs.longitude: float – optional – Longitude for geo-based search (must be used with latitude)
inputs.latitude: float – optional – Latitude for geo-based search (must be used with longitude)
inputs.radius: integer – optional – Search radius in meters (minimum 1000m). Use with longitude/latitude for geo-based search
inputs.min_reviews_count: integer – optional – Minimum number of reviews (e.g., 100, 500)
inputs.star_rating: string – optional – Comma-separated list of star ratings (e.g., '4.0,5.0' for 4 and 5 star hotels)
inputs.hotel_ids: string – optional – Comma-separated list of specific hotel IDs to fetch (e.g., 'lp1897,lp1343')

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.hotels: array – list of hotel objects with comprehensive metadata (id, name, description, address, rating, stars, amenities, images, etc.)
outputs.hotel_ids: array – list of hotel IDs returned in this search
outputs.total: integer – total number of hotels matching the search criteria (may be more than returned due to limit)
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

book_hotel_room.description: Book a hotel room using LiteAPI. This tool creates a confirmed booking with payment processing. Use this tool when the user wants to complete a hotel reservation after selecting a specific hotel and rate. The tool requires hotel_id and rate_id (optionRefId) from previous hotel rate searches, along with guest information and payment details. Returns booking confirmation details including booking_id and confirmation_code.
use_cases: User wants to book a specific hotel room after viewing rates
User has selected a hotel and rate and wants to complete the reservation
User provides payment information to confirm a booking
important_notes: REQUIRES rate_id (optionRefId) from get_hotel_rates response - you must first search for rates to get a valid rate_id
This tool processes payment and creates a confirmed booking
All guest and payment information is required
The rate_id should be the optionRefId from the hotel rates response

inputs.hotel_id: string – required – unique ID of the hotel to book (obtained from hotel search or rates response)
inputs.rate_id: string – required – rate ID or optionRefId from the hotel rates response (this is the specific rate/room option the user selected)
inputs.checkin: string – required – check-in date in YYYY-MM-DD format (ISO 8601)
inputs.checkout: string – required – check-out date in YYYY-MM-DD format (ISO 8601)
inputs.occupancies: array – required – array of occupancy objects, each with 'adults' (integer, required) and optionally 'children' (array of integers representing ages)
inputs.guest_email: string – required – guest's email address (must be valid email format)
inputs.card_number: string – required – credit card number (13-19 digits, spaces/dashes will be removed)
inputs.card_expiry: string – required – card expiry date in MM/YY or MM/YYYY format (e.g., '12/25' or '12/2025')
inputs.card_cvv: string – required – card CVV code (3 or 4 digits)
inputs.card_holder_name: string – required – name on the credit card
inputs.currency: string – optional – currency code (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR'). Default: USD
inputs.client_reference: string – optional – client reference number for tracking the booking
inputs.remarks: string – optional – additional remarks or special requests for the hotel

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, PAYMENT_ERROR, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.booking: object – complete booking details from the API response
outputs.booking_id: string – unique booking ID/identifier for the confirmed reservation
outputs.confirmation_code: string – hotel confirmation code or reference number for the booking
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors
